content:
Here's a customized checklist for you:

**Essential Accounts:**

* Email providers (e.g., Gmail, Outlook) **(Already done: Social Media)**
* Banking and Finance (e.g., online banking) **(Already done: Credit Cards)**
* Government Services (e.g., Social Security Administration, IRS)

**Important Accounts:**

* Online Shopping:
	+ Amazon
* Subscription Services:
	+ Netflix
	+ Hulu
* Productivity and Cloud Storage: **(No updates needed)**
* Travel and Booking: **(No updates needed)**

**Health and Wellness:**

* Health Insurance Provider
* Dentist's Office
* Medical Providers (e.g., primary care physician, specialists) **(Consider updating if applicable)**

**Employer and HR:**

* Notify HR department about name change for payroll updates

**Other Accounts:**

* None listed (but feel free to add any additional accounts you think of)

Now that you have this checklist, you can start updating your accounts one by one. Make sure to keep track of the updates you've made and any new login credentials or passwords you create.

Some additional tips:

* When updating your health insurance provider, be sure to also update your name on any related accounts, such as your health savings account (HSA) or flexible spending account (FSA).
* If you have any automatic payments or subscriptions linked to your old name, update those as well to avoid any disruptions.
* Consider reaching out to your employer's HR department to confirm what specific documents they need from you to update your payroll information.

You're making great progress!
